Steps to Reproduce:
Start Visual Studio Code
1. Open Debug console (Ctrl+Shift+Y)
2. Open Terminal (Ctrl+`)
3. Type command exit in terminal and press enter

Expected result: exit the terminal without closing debug console
Current result: closes entire bottom panel with debug console

data.title: Debug Console sometimes ignores logging of empty lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Debian GNU/Linux 8.7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a small Node application like this:

```
for (let i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
    console.log();
    console.log("test", i);
}
```

2. Launch it in the debugger and check the output on the debug console. You'll see that sometimes there is no empty line between the "test" lines. The output is always different. So if you don't see the problem then try again or scroll up.

The problem can't be reproduced in the terminal, only in the debug console. `console.log("")` also doesn't work. Logging a single space character instead works. 

Here is a screenshot showing the problem (Notice the missing line breaks between test65/test66 and test79/test80/test81):

![broken-empty-lines](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/580493/24828379/0ce5e5da-1c5c-11e7-951c-72ea6a5b36e2.png)

data.title: Extension authoring - Live updates without saving
Build task broken with new version: Cannot read property 'config' of undefined
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:
Can't really since its in my own project.

So yesterday I was working on my TypeScript project with Gulp, node and browserify and everything was building perfectly. I went to bed and today when I wake up I code for a bit, build a few more times and then I get a message to update VS Code. Great. I updated it and then I could no longer build my project. I just get the following error:

`Cannot read property 'config' of undefined`

Which is not very helpful since grepping the codebase will return dozens of possible `config` variables. However, I'm able to run `gulp build` in the terminal and everything builds smoothly.

I'm not sure what other information I can give you, but feel free to ask.

data.title: How to read a file without using node native module.
data.body:
Hi, I'm developing an extension for evernote. I need to read a file to get the css code. But the code do not support native node module. As a result, some platform installed my extension will go wrong.

How to resolve this, is there any way to read a file inside the vscode? 

Here is my repo. In ubuntu 16.04 everything goes well, however windows will fail with an unexpected error.
Use vscode 1.11.1
https://github.com/michalyao/evermonkey


Thanks.

data.title: Hide collapse icon if folder is empty
data.body:

- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a directory with multiple folders / files
2. You cannot see which folders are empty: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16874688/24826980/a6d833c4-1c42-11e7-8e79-023196223b61.png)

3. Only after toggling. (folder2 is empty)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16874688/24826999/ebb289d6-1c42-11e7-8a68-aaac6f101da7.png)

4. It would be much cleaner if you get a visible hint if the folder is empty, e.g. hide the collapse icon

data.title: Copy with drag and drop not work in Ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.11.1
- OS Version:Ubuntu 16.04 x64

Select a text and drag, the selected text won't be moved. VS code treats the operation as simply clicking and moving to select another part of text.

As Ubuntu has key conflict with ALT, I run `gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.wm.preferences mouse-button-modifier '<Super><Alt>'` first. However, I still cannot copy the text when I hold alt.

Thanks for the necessary feature. I can use it in Windows.

data.title: Feature Request - Search with more mode
data.body:
The search function will do search with whole workspace, may it be possible to control the mode?
- Search in current file.
- Search in opened files.
- Search in workspace.(current mode)

This may cost less and easy to use in some situations.

data.title: Ripgrep: match not found when using match-case, match-word
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. search for `new FileEditorInput`
2. enable match-case, match-word

=> no results found

Disable ripgrep and find one result.

This seems like a serious regression from before and will probably cause quite some frustration when matches are not found. I very often rely on the fact that search is accurate and I very often use the combination of match-case and match-word even when I use for multiple words.

data.title: Debugger retrieves wrong <node internals> code using legacy protocol
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1 (works in 1.10.2)
- OS Version: Win10
- Setup: an electron app that has one node subprocess launched with debug port. VS configured to attach to that port, with protocol explicitly set to "legacy". The app (screeps private server) loads multiple user scripts (one of them is being debugged). The scripts are all called `main.js` and somehow loaded through lots of other js.

VSCode 1.10.2 attaches and breaks on `debugger;` statement, retrieving correct js file from node. When adding a breakpoint VSCode shows it as `main \1000\<node internals>`. Stack trace and locals show up correctly.

VSCode 1.11.1 attaches and breaks on `debugger;` statement, retrieving code for wrong `main`. Stack trace and locals still show up correctly and I can step through with correct effects. Newly added breakpoint is shown as `main <node internals>` (missing /1000/ part comparing to 1.10.2).

This looks like a regression in 1.11.1, I reverted back to 1.10.2 and right file is opened.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:55:56.395Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-65-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|swagger-viewer|Arjun|1.4.0|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.1|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-auto-open-markdown-preview|hnw|0.0.4|
|plantuml|jebbs|1.4.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.59|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3|
|Theme-MarkdownKit|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|java|redhat|0.1.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|
|Spell|seanmcbreen|0.9.1|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Install 1.11.1 code (sudo dpkg -i code_1.11.1-1491486998_amd64.deb)
2. Update pkgs (sudo apt-get install -f)
3. Launch code
4. Observe navigations keys (PC keyboard) not working.
5. Go back to 1.10.2 code (sudo dpkg -i code_1.10.2-1488981323_amd64)
6. Update pkgs again (sudo apt-get install -f)
7. Observe navigation keys (PC keyboard) working fine.

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-javascript-snippet-pack|akamud|0.1.5|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|

|TrelloVSCodeExtension|katvharris|0.1.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|latex|ms-vscode|0.1.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3|
|promise-snippets|progre|0.2.3|
|ejs-language-support|QassimFarid|0.0.1|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|Spell|seanmcbreen|0.9.1|
|guides|spywhere|0.7.0|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open folder in VSCode
2. Open command prompt
3. Navigate to a different folder within the command prompt.
4. Run the `code .` command to open the current folder in a new instance of VSCode.
5. Behold the blank editor. The title bar shows the correct folder and I do have the menu (i.e. File, Edit, Selection, etc.) but nothing else. Even the left sidebar is missing.

Below is a screenshot showing the two editors. The editor on the left is the first folder I opened and the editor on the right is the second one that I opened.

![2017-04-07 21_18_47-grunt-contrib-copy - visual studio code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2483249/24824784/f025b35a-1bd7-11e7-8ea9-eb58b6772209.png)

data.title: "CMD +" to zoom breaks page layout.
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |rainbow-brackets|2gua|0.0.6| |beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2| |indent-rainbow|oderwat|0.5.1| |vscode-subword-navigation|ow|1.1.5| |trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|; --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open an extension details page. 2. Enlarge text using the shortcut "CMD +" Expected: Text resizes without changing position of scrollbars. Actual: Scrollbars are inset ~200px, compromising the expected layout.
